dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 4546 IH: National Securities Exchange Regulatory Parity Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Royce of California (for himself and Mr. Hultgren) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the Securities Act of 1933 to specify when a nationally traded security is exempt from State regulation of security offerings.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the National Securities Exchange Regulatory Parity Act.
Section 18(b)(1) of the Securities Act of 1933 (15 U.S.C. 77r(b)(1)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by inserting a security designated as qualified for trading in the national market system pursuant to section 11A(a)(2) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 that is before listed; and

by striking that has listing standards that the Commission determines by rule (on its own initiative or on the basis of a petition) are substantially similar to the listing standards applicable to securities described in subparagraph (A);

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (C), by striking or (B); and
by redesignating subparagraphs (B) and (C) as subparagraphs (A) and (B), respectively.
